intro: Marrubium incanum, commonly known as the white horehound, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. Marrubium incanum is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental species. It has been historically used in herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
